title: Thank you Matt
content: Hello Matt, this is Ilio Pieroni thanking you for explaining that my problem was caused by VPN doing a very good job in masking me out of existence, and being blacklisted. The moment I turned it off, every worked again. I contacted bitdefender, including your response. Waiting for a replay. Thank you again Matt, much appreciated. Regards Ilio Pieroni
creator: Iliopier

title: Thunderbird just updated and most of my e-mails became unreadable
content:
This is what most of my received e-mail messages now look like:

<td align=3D"left" bgcolor=3D"#ED3B30">

Some e-mails can still be read but the message is from a previously deleted e-mail and is not what the current e-mail is about. (A message from a previous e-mail has been inserted into the body of the new e-mail and the info. in the new e-mail has vanished.)

Can someone help me? Thank you.
creator: cahwhite

title: Enable Calendars in TB 115.10.1
content:
I have nine calendars on my TB calendar page.

Some weeks ago, seven of them stopped displaying. They each have a gray Enable button next to their name in the Calendars list, but it doesn't do anything.

How can I reenable these calendars?

(14 other people have a similar problem in the post Enable Calendars in TB V.115.8.0 but it has been archived.)
creator: Toolworker

title: Sent folder of iCloud mail address has empty messages
content: I have two iCloud mails in Thunderbird. The older one runs great. For the other new one - same settings - mails sent often appear totally blank in the sent folder. Going to the iCloud webmail, sent messages appear totally normal and mails are sent to destination without any problem. I tried everything, no avail. Also weird is I have two "sent" folders (for no clear reason). Both have this issue, not always. See screenshot of iCloud webmail.
creator: bjprc

content:

Thank You,

title: TB MARK MESSAGE AS READ "When Thunderbird determines that they are junk" OPTION DOES NOT WORK
content: TB latest version on MacOS latest version TB has option to mark messages as read if it determines them to be junk this does NOT work. It puts them in junk folder but keeps them as unread. very inconvenient... any solutions? thanks (attached)
creator: rezganj

title: Download Xfinity/Comcast email to Thunderbird
content:
I am maxing out my Comcast email space allowance (10 gb) and want to move it all to my PC. (i don’t want an encrypted backup, but something readable.) I thought I could use Thunderbird and set up a POP3 account on Thunderbird with the option to leave emails on the server. It downloaded only the Inbox, not the subfolders. I read on the Forum that that is what happens with POP3. My understanding of IMAP is that I don’t get the actual email on Thunderbird, because it stays on the Comcast server.

Is there a way to download all those emails and folders to Thundebird (to keep) and then delete them from Comcast? I don’t plan to use the Thunderbird client for my day-to-day email, simply to store the last 10 years of email.

I have tried to research the forum articles so that I don’t bother anyone needlessly, but can’t find an answer. Thank you.
creator: lrob
